section.title: Backup and restore
section.para: The following sections describe the different areas of Package Drone which should be backed up and how they can be restored.

section.title: System settings
section.para: These settings contain the information about which database to use and the configuration of the mail server. It does not contain the user information, the channel configuration or anything else from the database.
Technically this is all configuration information stored in the OSGi configuration administrator.

In order to back up these settings go to System Backup and click on the Export button. This will start the export trigger the download of a ZIP file containing all information. The ZIP file can later be restored.
For restoring the data, again go to System Backup and select the file to import in the Import configuration section. Start the import process by pressing the Import button.

section.title: File format of system configuration
section.para: The file is an XML file with the root element configuration, the version attribute must have the value 1.

The children are elements with the name entry. Each defining an OSGi configuration admin object. Either the pid attribute or the factoryPid attribute has to be set to the service PID or the factory PID that this element should be created for.
Each configuration element contains one or more property element with the attributes key, type and the value as text content.
The type attribute contains the Java class name which of the value.

section.title: System data
section.para: All data like artifacts, the artifact binary data, users, deploy keys, all this is stored in the database that is configured for the Package Drone instance. At the moment of writing (Version 0.2.4) there is no backup mechanism for this data. But since it is stored in a MySQL database, you can and should use the mechanisms provided by MySQL for backup up your database.

tip.title: Database backup
tip.para: If you have a backup of your database, then you have the necessary data you need to re-create an instance of Package Drone.
